poem:
**Martian Enigma**

In serrated deserts of scarlet dust,
Nathalie whispers to a world long lost.
Eons of secrets cradled in rust,
echoes of rivers beneath the frost.

From Parisian whispers to alien dreams,
she maps the ghost of ancient streams.
Mars, a riddle in cosmic seams,
awaits her touch, or so it seems.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Astrobiologist Nathalie Cabrol: ‘I believe Mars still has some big surprises for us’ The astrobiologist Nathalie Cabrol was born in 1963 and raised near Paris. She completed a PhD at the Sorbonne on the evolution of water on Mars and moved to the US in 1994 as a researcher at Nasa Ames. She has worked extensively in the Atacama desert and the Chilean Andes, exploring how life adapts to extreme environments analogous to those on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
